text.p: Following are the main stories in Thursday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- All newspapers carried story from Asiaweek which said Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad was the second most powerful man in Asia. It said four Malaysian were in the top 50 ranked by the magazine, with Chinese President Jiang Zemin ranked the most powerful.

-- Bank Negara's recent lending curbs was an attempt to prevent collapse of the property sector, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad was quoted as saying in London, where he is on a work-and-holiday routine.
-- The Italian government has agreed to grant additional flights to national carrier, Malaysia Airline System Bhd .

-- Maju Holdings Sdn Bhd, which is leading a rescue of ailing Perwaja Steel Sdn Bhd, is buying the 80 percent stake in Berjaya Singer Bhd for a backdoor listing of the recently privatised steel company.
-- Tenaga Nasional Bhd is said to be splitting its operations into six divisions in a restructuring state-run power utility.
